title: Bangladeshi Hackers Target Nepali Cyber Cafes

The attack is reportedly a retaliation for a previous cyber attack by a Nepali hacker group, 'Anonymous Nepal,' on Bangladeshi police websites.

suspect.name: Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli
suspect.activity: Running a YouTube channel 'KP Ba' and engaging in a public discussion about the regulation of pseudonyms on social media, which includes provisions for penalties related to anonymity and misleading information.

response.official: The bill has sparked controversy, with provisions to impose fines or imprisonment for sharing content under pseudonyms or misleading information on social networks.
response.investigation: The bill is being discussed in Parliament, and the public's reaction to it is still developing. Further legal steps are under consideration.

title: Apple Agrees to Pay $1 Billion Over Siri Recording User Conversations
description: Apple has agreed to pay $1 billion to settle allegations of secretly recording users' personal conversations through the virtual assistant Siri. The case dates back five years, with accusations that Apple secretly activated Siri to record private conversations from iPhones and other Apple devices. Some of these recordings were allegedly sold to advertisers. Despite agreeing to pay the settlement, Apple has not admitted to wrongdoing. If the agreement is approved, eligible consumers may receive compensation for affected devices.

suspect.name: Apple Inc.
suspect.activity: Secretly activating Siri to record users' personal conversations without consent and allegedly selling the data to advertisers.

response.official: Apple has agreed to pay $1 billion as part of a settlement over the recording of personal conversations through Siri. The company has denied any wrongdoing despite agreeing to the settlement.
response.investigation: The case will be finalized after approval by U.S. District Judge Jeffrey White, with compensation being available to affected consumers from September 1, 2016, to the end of 2020.

title: Side Effects of Online Romance in Nepal: From Porn Requests to Humiliation
description: A disturbing report by Child Safe Net highlights the growing issue of online intimate partner violence (IPV) in Nepal. The study, conducted in collaboration with the Sexual Violence Research Initiative, reveals that unprotected digital technology use is leading to increased violence among adolescents and young adults involved in online relationships. These include emotional abuse, controlling behavior, and even the demand for explicit content. The study, which surveyed 4,000 participants, found significant levels of online IPV, particularly in the Sunsari District. Participants reported online abuse, including being asked for explicit photos and being controlled or monitored by their partners.

suspect.name: Online Partners
suspect.activity: Engaging in online violence, including emotional manipulation, surveillance, and demanding explicit content from partners in online relationships.

response.official: The study sheds light on the growing issue of online IPV, especially among young people, and urges increased awareness and protection for digital relationships.
response.investigation: The Child Safe Net study aims to raise awareness and push for better safety measures for vulnerable individuals engaging in online relationships.

title: Indian Citizens Arrested for Online Gambling Operations in Nepal, Including 'OneX Bet'
description: A group of Indian citizens has been arrested in Nepal for conducting illegal online gambling operations. The arrests took place in Rundehi after a team from the District Police Office acted on confidential information about online gambling activities. The individuals were found operating multiple gambling platforms, including popular websites like 'OneX Bet,' which facilitated betting on various sports such as cricket, football, and horse races. Police recovered smartphones, laptops, and routers used in the illegal activities. Several individuals were arrested, including Sahil Soda, Anurag Singh, and Shyam Gupta, among others.

suspect.name: Indian Citizens
suspect.activity: Operating illegal online gambling activities using various platforms like OneX Bet, Lords Exchange, and others, involving betting on sports such as cricket, football, and horse races.

response.official: The District Police Office conducted a raid after receiving confidential information, leading to the arrest of several Indian nationals involved in illegal online gambling operations in Nepal.
response.investigation: The police are continuing their investigation to trace the full scope of the online gambling ring and its operations in Nepal, including the use of various betting websites.

title: Online Fraud Involving Young People Increases in Nepal: National Bank Report
description: A recent report by the Nepal Nation Bank Financial Information Unit reveals a rise in online fraud cases, particularly involving young people. The report, based on the analysis of Suspicious Activity Reports (SAR) and Suspicious Business Reports (STR), found that individuals aged 18 to 25 are the most active group involved in online fraud, accounting for a significant percentage of cases. The report also highlights the involvement of students, job holders, and a range of other individuals, including housewives, unemployed people, and small business operators. The misuse of new accounts is also a key trend in the rise of these cybercrimes.

suspect.name: Young People (Ages 18-25) and Various Individuals
suspect.activity: Involvement in online fraud through the misuse of new bank accounts, often within three to nine months of account opening.

response.official: The Nepal Nation Bank's Financial Information Unit has highlighted the rising trend of online fraud among younger individuals and students, urging greater vigilance from financial institutions, banks, and service providers.
response.investigation: The authorities are continuing to monitor and investigate the increase in online fraud cases, with a focus on the misuse of newly opened accounts and the involvement of various groups in these fraudulent activities.

title: Editor and Publisher of Zikura Datcom Sentenced for Fake Audio Case
description: The editor and publisher of Zikura Datcom, along with a journalist, have been sentenced for broadcasting a fake audio in a sting operation. The Supreme Court sentenced the executive editor, Dhuangana, and publisher Yuvraj Kandel to three months in prison, while journalist Prince Timsina received a six-month sentence. The fake audio, which implicated a Supreme Court judge in a corruption scandal, was broadcast on the YouTube channel of Zikura Datcom. The court found them guilty of violating the Electronic Trade Act and abusive behavior. Police investigations revealed that the audio was fabricated.

suspect.name: Dhuangana (Editor), Yuvraj Kandel (Publisher), Prince Timsina (Journalist)
suspect.activity: Broadcasting a fake audio implicating a Supreme Court judge in a corruption scandal, violating the Electronic Trade Act and defaming the judiciary.

response.official: The Supreme Court has sentenced the individuals involved in the fake audio case to prison, with a decision to respect the ruling. The case has drawn attention to the issue of defamation and the spreading of fake news.
response.investigation: The police's Central Investigation Bureau (CIB) concluded that the audio broadcast by Zikura Datcom was fabricated, leading to the charges under the Electronic Trade Act and for abusive behavior.

title: Nepali Man Loses Rs 1 Million to Online Scam After Being Lured by Fake Job Offer
description: A Nepali man, who traveled to Saudi Arabia to work and support his family, fell victim to an online scam when he was approached by a woman claiming to work for Amazon. After engaging in conversation and receiving an enticing offer to earn large sums of money from a part-time job, the victim, Amati, ended up sending Rs 1 million to the scammers. The woman, initially reaching out through WhatsApp, convinced Amati to participate in the scam, promising significant earnings. This case highlights the growing trend of online fraud targeting individuals seeking opportunities abroad.

suspect.name: Lena Urban Coco (Fraudulent Profile)
suspect.activity: Engaging in a scam by offering fake job opportunities to individuals abroad and convincing them to send money for fake tasks.

response.official: The case has been reported as an online scam targeting foreign workers. Authorities are advising citizens to be cautious when approached by unknown individuals offering seemingly lucrative job opportunities.
response.investigation: The authorities are continuing to investigate the fraudulent activities of the individual using the fake Amazon job offer to defraud individuals of significant sums of money.

title: Nepal and Singapore Collaborate to Reduce Financial Crimes in Fintech Sector
description: Nepali IT and fintech company, Techrida Inc., has partnered with Singapore-based JForth Solutions to tackle financial crimes such as money laundering and terrorism financing in Nepal's fintech sector. The partnership aims to provide financial institutions with tools and training to meet international standards for crime prevention. This initiative follows a rise in banking fraud and financial crime incidents in Kathmandu Valley last year, underscoring the need for enhanced security in the fintech industry.

suspect.name: N/A
suspect.activity: Financial institutions being provided with training and tools to prevent financial crimes, including money laundering and terrorism financing.

response.official: The collaboration between Techrida Inc. and JForth Solutions represents a significant step toward ensuring the sustainability and stability of Nepal's fintech sector by addressing financial crimes.
response.investigation: The partnership aims to equip financial institutions with the necessary resources to reduce financial crime risks and comply with regulations in both local and international contexts.

title: Friend from Facebook Forcefully Takes Advantage of Teenager
description: A 16-year-old girl, Reshma Rout, was coerced by a group of five young men, including Padam Thapa, who she met through Facebook seven months ago. The men, after meeting the teenager in person, forced her into a physical relationship, with the assistance of others, and threatened her with her mobile phone. Following the incident, the victim reported the crime to the police, leading to an investigation. The incident has led to charges of forced coercion and assault against the accused.

title: Deputy Mayor Dungol Files Complaint Against Fake AI Video and Social Media Harassment
description: Deputy Mayor Sunita Dungol of Kathmandu has filed a complaint with the Cyber Bureau after AI technology was used to create a fake video and spread defamatory content about her. The fake video, using deepfake technology, depicted a scene with her and Mayor Balen Shah. Dungol has also requested the closure of fake social media accounts created in her name, particularly a Facebook page that continues to operate despite previous requests for its removal.

suspect.activity: Using deepfake technology to create defamatory videos and fake social media pages.

response.official: Deputy Mayor Dungol has requested immediate action to remove the defamatory content from social networks and take legal action against the perpetrators of this character assassination.
response.investigation: The Cyber Bureau is investigating the use of AI technology to create fake content and has been urged to close the fake Facebook pages linked to Dungol's name.

title: Concerns Over Cyber Security Policy and National Internet Gateway Impacting Privacy and Freedom
description: Digital Rights Nepal released analysis papers highlighting the implications of the National Cyber Security Policy and the proposed National Internet Gateway (NIG). These policies raise concerns about the erosion of individual privacy and internet freedom, which could potentially lead to violations of human rights.

suspect.name: N/A
suspect.activity: Analysis of potential impacts of government cybersecurity policies and the National Internet Gateway on citizens' rights to internet freedom and privacy.

response.official: Digital Rights Nepal has raised alarms over the potential threats to privacy and internet independence posed by the government's cybersecurity initiatives.
response.investigation: Further monitoring and analysis of the government's cybersecurity policies and their potential human rights implications are recommended.

title: Nepali Woman Arrested for Involvement in Online Scam and Human Trafficking in Myanmar
description: A 27-year-old woman, Kavita Gurung, was arrested for allegedly trafficking Nepali individuals to Myanmar, where they were forced into online scams. The victims were promised jobs involving English typing with a lucrative salary but were coerced into scamming people on social media to invest in virtual currencies like Bitcoin. The victims were also subjected to physical and mental torture if they failed to meet their targets.

suspect.name: Kavita Gurung
suspect.activity: Trafficking individuals to Myanmar for forced participation in online scams targeting foreigners, particularly through social media platforms.

response.official: Kavita Gurung has been arrested by the police, and investigations are ongoing. The Kathmandu District Court has extended her remand for further investigation. The police are also searching for other individuals involved in the scam.
response.investigation: Further investigation is ongoing to identify other suspects and to address the broader issue of human trafficking for online fraud.

title: Graphics Designer Arrested for Making Over a Thousand Fake Educational Certificates
description: A graphics designer, Cyrus Vicakhe, has been arrested by the Kathmandu Valley Crime Investigation Office for producing over a thousand fake educational certificates. The police discovered a fraudulent certificate while investigating suspicious documents related to individuals who traveled abroad on visit visas. Upon investigation, Vicakhe admitted to producing numerous fake academic certificates.

suspect.name: Cyrus Vicakhe
suspect.activity: Creating and distributing fake educational certificates for individuals traveling abroad.

response.official: Cyrus Vicakhe has been arrested and further investigation is ongoing. The police are verifying the evidence obtained, including his phone and CPU, to identify the extent of the fraud.
response.investigation: The police have begun a thorough investigation and are looking into the number of people involved in using these fake certificates.

title: Vietnamese Hacker Takes Control of Finance Minister's Facebook Page
description: A Vietnamese hacker took control of Finance Minister Prakasharan Mahat's official Facebook page on June 1. The page was restored after a month of control by the hacker, with the help of the technical team from the Finance Minister's office. The page had been inaccessible after the loss of the old password and was brought back with assistance from Meta. No unauthorized posts were made during the period of control.

suspect.name: Unknown (Vietnamese Hacker)
suspect.activity: Hacking and taking control of the official Facebook page of the Finance Minister.

response.official: The Finance Minister's team regained control of the Facebook page after a month-long struggle, working with Meta to resolve the issue.
response.investigation: The investigation focuses on the hacking incident, but no unnecessary posts were made by the hacker during the period of control.

title: Cyber Bureau Takes Action Against Thousands Involved in Online Crime
description: In the fiscal year 20â°â°/060, Nepal's Cyber Bureau has taken action against approximately six thousand individuals involved in various online crimes. The bureau has investigated over five thousand complaints filed under the Electronic Trade Act 20â°â°. The complaints involved issues such as online harassment, hate speech, defamation, and violations related to public ethics and etiquette in electronic media.

title: Couple Arrested for Stealing and Selling IT Equipment from Multiple Companies
description: A couple, including a man with a criminal background, has been arrested for stealing IT equipment, including laptops and phones, from various IT companies. The stolen goods were sold at a cheaper price through an online platform, 'Our Market Dotcom.' The couple had been involved in this activity as part of their plans to raise money to go to Australia. Police confiscated multiple stolen items from their apartment, and further investigations are underway.

title: Nepali Virgin Girl APK Spreading Malware, Targeting Banking and Digital Payment Users
description: A new form of malware named 'Nepali Virgin Girl APK' is being spread through WhatsApp messages that claim to help users find a sex partner. The APK targets users of mobile banking and digital payment services. Once installed, the malware can take control of the device, stealing sensitive information such as bank account details. The cybercrime investigation team has reported multiple complaints from users who have lost money after installing the APK.

suspects.name: Indian and Nepali fraudsters
suspects.activity: Creating and distributing the malware through fraudulent APKs to steal users' personal and financial information.

response.official: The Kathmandu Valley Crime Investigation Office has arrested 8 Indian nationals and 7 Nepali citizens on charges of fraud. The malware, originally known as 'Nepali Girl APK,' had previously caused millions of rupees in losses. The app is now circulating under a new name. The police are investigating the matter further and advising users not to click on suspicious links.
response.investigation: The police are conducting internal research into how the app collects bank account details and spreads malware. Users are being urged to avoid clicking on suspicious links and to report any incidents of fraud or malware to the authorities.

title: Personal Details of 20 Million Nepali Voters Exposed Online, High Risk of Abuse
description: The Election Commission of Nepal has made the personal details of around 20 million voters publicly available on their website. This includes sensitive data such as voter names, ages, spouse names, and parents' names. The Commission's decision to publish this information without proper privacy safeguards has raised concerns about identity theft, fraud, and potential misuse. The exposure increases the likelihood of cyberattacks and unauthorized access to voter information.

suspects.name: Election Commission of Nepal
suspects.activity: Publishing personal voter details online without proper privacy protections, violating data protection laws.

response.official: The Election Commission has made the voter details public for election transparency, but they have not implemented sufficient privacy protection measures for online exposure. Civil rights organizations have raised concerns about the risks of data abuse and privacy violations.
response.investigation: The issue has raised legal and cybersecurity concerns, with experts warning that this data exposure could lead to fraud, fake accounts, and identity theft. The Election Commission has not yet shown a technical solution to safeguard the privacy of voters' data online.

laws_violated: Article 2 of Nepal's Constitution - Right to Privacy

title: Indian Citizen Arrested for Bypassing International Calls and Leaking Revenue in Nepal
description: Irfan Sufian Khan, an Indian citizen, was arrested for operating an illegal call bypassing operation in Nepal, resulting in significant revenue leakage for telecommunication providers. He used VoIP and GOIP technology to reroute international calls as local calls, bypassing Nepal Telecom and Ncell's legitimate routes. This caused financial losses for telecom companies and violated Nepal's Telecommunications Act.

suspects.name: Irfan Sufian Khan
suspects.activity: Operating an illegal call bypass center, using unauthorized technology to reroute international calls, causing revenue loss for telecom companies.

response.official: A joint team from the District Police Office and the Cyber Bureau arrested Khan after investigating his illegal operations. The authorities seized equipment including VoIP gateways, routers, and SIM cards from Nepal Telecom and Ensel, which were being used for bypassing international calls.
response.investigation: The investigation is ongoing, and Khan is being held under the Telecommunications Act for further legal action.

potential_consequences: Revenue leakage due to unauthorized call rerouting

title: Increasing Misuse of SMS, CIB's Request to Remain Vigilant Against Fraudulent SMS Scams
description: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CIB) of Nepal has issued a public alert regarding the increasing misuse of SMS for fraudulent activities. Scammers are sending SMS messages claiming that recipients have been in contact with a person who tested positive for COVID-19 and are required to undergo a PCR test, threatening a fine if ignored. These SMS messages are misleading and are part of a scam to deceive users into providing personal or financial information. The CIB urges citizens to remain vigilant and avoid falling victim to such scams.

suspects.name: Unknown fraudsters
suspects.activity: Sending fraudulent SMS messages to deceive users into providing personal information and committing financial fraud.

response.official: The CIB has issued a public statement urging citizens to remain vigilant against fraudulent SMS scams. The police advise mobile users to ignore suspicious messages and not share personal information through SMS. The police are investigating the source of these fraudulent messages and have warned people not to click on suspicious links or respond to offers of lotteries or discounts, which are part of the scam.
response.investigation: The police are working to identify the perpetrators of the fraudulent SMS scams and are advising the public to report any such messages to authorities or telecom providers. Further investigations are underway to trace the origins of these scams and to prevent further misuse.

title: France Passes Law to Remove Hate Speech Within 2 Hours on Online Platforms
description: The lower house of France has passed a controversial law requiring online platforms to remove hate speech, including content related to threats of violence, discrimination, and genocide, within 2 hours. This law imposes fines on companies that fail to comply with the regulation, including severe penalties for failure to remove more serious content, such as counter-terrorism material and child pornography, within an hour. The law aims to combat the growing problem of hate speech on social media and online platforms.

suspects.name: Social Media Platforms
suspects.activity: Failure to remove hate speech and harmful content from their platforms in a timely manner.

response.official: The French government has passed the new law with a focus on removing harmful content, such as hate speech, terrorism-related material, and child exploitation, from online platforms within very short timeframes. The law imposes severe fines, including up to 4% of a company's global annual income for non-compliance.
response.investigation: The French Superior Council of Audio-Visual will regulate the enforcement of this law, and penalties will be applied to platforms that fail to act swiftly to remove prohibited content.

description: Small clips from the Nepali movie 'Shameless Asylum' have been uploaded illegally on platforms like Ticket, Instagram, and Facebook Reels. These clips include critical parts of the movie, including the climax and key scenes. This unauthorized sharing is causing significant financial loss to the filmmakers and the Nepali film industry. Filmmakers and stakeholders are raising concerns over the increasing misuse of movie content on social media.

response.investigation: The film industry is urging law enforcement and social media platforms to take action against illegal content sharing and protect intellectual property rights.

title: 22-Year-Old Young Man's Struggle with Online Gambling Addiction and Debt
description: A 22-year-old man, Silk Panziar, has lost millions of rupees to online gambling. After falling into addiction, he borrowed money from friends, family, and relatives to fund his gambling habits. Unable to pay back the debt, he sought help from the Kathmandu Valley Crime Research Office. He shared the painful consequences of his addiction, noting that online gambling can be more intoxicating than drugs and has ruined the lives of many young people, including himself.

suspects.name: Online Gambling Platforms
suspects.activity: Providing access to gambling opportunities that lead to addiction and significant financial losses for users.

response.official: The Kathmandu Valley Crime Research Office is investigating the matter and looking into the operations of online gambling platforms that continue to function openly, despite causing harm to users.
response.investigation: Police are conducting investigations into how these online gambling platforms operate and the measures that can be taken to protect young people from falling into addiction and debt.

title: Ministry of Health's Website Hacked by 'Captain Smoker3R' Hacker Group
description: The website of Nepal's Ministry of Health and Population was hacked by a group identifying itself as 'Captain Smoker3R'. The group altered the website to display 'Hacked by Captain Smoker3R', and changed details of staff including the Minister of Health, Pradip Poudel. The website is currently down while attempts are being made to restore it. The extent of data loss from the hack is not yet confirmed.

suspects.name: Captain Smoker3R
suspects.activity: Hacking government websites and changing content, leaving links to their Telegram group, and possibly affiliated with the Bangalore-based hacker group 'Thunder Cyber Team'.

response.official: The Ministry of Health's spokesperson, Dr. Prakash Bhagathoki, confirmed the attack and stated that efforts are underway to bring the website back online. The IT team has been instructed to resolve the issue immediately.
response.investigation: The investigation is ongoing to determine the full extent of the damage and to trace the responsible hackers. Authorities are also looking into connections to the 'Thunder Cyber Team' from Bangalore.

title: Complaints Filed Against Comedian Sajan Shrestha and Podcaster Suu Kyat Pradha for Social Media Video
description: A complaint has been filed against comedian Sajan Shrestha, festival organizer Sapkota, and podcaster Suu Kyat Pradha for a video uploaded to social media that allegedly disrupted social harmony. The video, which featured a discussion on the impact of the social networking bill, included content that some viewers found offensive. The incident escalated when Shrestha performed a song that offended singer Kuma Sagar, leading to public outcry and criticism on social media. The video has since been removed from YouTube.

suspects.name: Sajan Shrestha, Sapkota, Suu Kyat Pradha
suspects.activity: Uploading a controversial video on social media platforms that disrupted social harmony and led to online backlash.

response.investigation: The police are investigating the complaint, focusing on whether the uploaded content violated any laws related to online harassment or disruption of public order. Legal action may follow depending on the findings.

title: Indrive Driver Harasses Passenger via WhatsApp, Case Filed Under Electronic Trade Act
description: A case has been filed against Baral, an Indrive driver, for harassing a female passenger via WhatsApp after an unfair demand for additional payment. The driver sent inappropriate messages to the victim, leading to the filing of a complaint under the Electronic Trade Act, which criminalizes such behavior. The incident has raised concerns about passenger safety on ride-sharing platforms.

title: Police in Cybercrime Research Face Delays Due to Lack of Cooperation from Social Platforms
description: The police's cyber bureau in Nepal has reported that many popular social media platforms are failing to cooperate in cybercrime investigations.
